text.p: Pioneer Financial Services Inc said Thursday it completed two previously announced acquisitions, SECURA Life Insurance Co and the remaining 50 percent of Markman International.
Both are designed to strengthen the national health and life insurer's marketing and distribution in its principal markets -- life insurance and senior health insurance.

Appleton, Wis.-based SECURA Life, which specializes in sales of term life and cash burial policies, was purchased for about $11.9 million. It had an estimated $20 million in gross annual premium revenue in 1996 and assets of about $90 million.

Pioneer also bought the remaining 50 percent of Markman, a company formed as a 50/50 joint venture in 1995 by Pioneer Life and the Markman Co to distribute Pioneer Life's plus-age-65 health and life insurance products.

"The completion of these two acquisitions, in conjunction with our planned merger with Conseco Inc in the spring of 1997, will bring the increasing sales momentum of Pioneer Financial Services' senior health and life marketing to Conseco," said Pioneer Financial chairman Peter Nauert.
